text.__SUMMARY__: Odostomia dealbata is a species of sea snail, a marine gastropod mollusk in the family Pyramidellidae, the pyrams and their allies.This is a nomen nudum, a naked name that has not been published with an adequate description (or a reference to such a description). Therefore, it cannot be accepted as it currently stands.
text.Description: The white shell is smooth and pellucid. There are six, rather convex whorls 6 with an inconspicuous fold The length of the shell is 4 mm.
text.Distribution:
This species occurs in the following locations:
Northwest Atlantic
text.Notes:
Additional information regarding this species:
Distribution: Range: 42.3°N to 41.3°N; 72°W to 71°W. Distribution: USA: Massachusetts, Connecticut
